titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Gayla B. Spaulding.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Deborah A. Richards. 2006-08-18

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Registrar of Smith College (1948-58). Contains correspondence and scrapbooks.

bioghist.p: Gladys Dingledine Diggs was a native of Harrisonburg, Virginia. She was a member of the Smith College class of 1922, and after graduation worked as the manager of the bookstore at Madison College, before returning to Smith to work in the registrar's office from 1929-1958. In 1945, Diggs received her Masters degree in history from the college. From 1951-52, she served as the Vice-president of the Northeastern Association of Collegiate Registrars and Admissions Officers. Diggs worked as registrar until her death on June 22, 1958. She left behind a daughter, Ellen-Fairbanks Diggs Bodman, Smith College Class of 1945, and 4 grandchildren.

scopecontent.p: The Gladys Dingledine Diggs Papers contain correspondence and scrapbooks spanning Diggs' youth and her career as Registrar of Smith College. The papers are divided in to two series as follows:

list.item:
Series I: Biographical Materials
This part of the collection consists of a memory book dated 9/1/13-10/4/15, a scrapbook dated 1915-1922 (mostly as her time as a Smith College Student), a scrapbook of Diggs' trip to the Middle East in 1952 and a written account of the trip.

Series II: Correspondence
This part of the collection contains two folders of correspondence to Agnes Stribling Dingledine and one folder of miscellaneous correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the papers must be requested from the College Archives. The Archives has no information on the status of literary rights in the collection and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Gladys Dingledine Diggs Papers, Box #, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The Gladys Dingledine Diggs Papers were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.

Scrapbook from trip to the Middle East 1952
